page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: {Esher}and{Claygate}are affluent residential areas with a strong sense of community.{West End}village,to the west of Esher,still has a semi-rural charm.Small parts of{Hinchley Wood}and {Hersham}extend into our area. The dominant impression our area gives is of wide,tree-lined roads with large well-built houses. There are many private roads and estates. Over half of the area is not built over.There are seven farms. Claremont Park is run by the National Trust and there are extensive commons and woodlands. The River Mole snakes its way northwards in the west of the area. Esher is the main focus of roads in the area.The building of the A3 Esher by-pass has had a big impact in the south of our area.Claygate station is on the Guildford-Waterloo line.
